generalInfo: From grand cities to medieval villages and dazzling coastlines, witness the iconic imagery that defines this western European haven. Discover the birthplace of port and the treasures of the Douro Valley, take a step back in time at the ancient university of Coimbra, learn the secrets of Porto’s backstreets and get to the heart of glorious Lisbon. Travel with a local leader and uncover the authentic side of Portugal; a land of rich history, vibrant regional cultures, stunning landscapes and refined cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Lisbon.
dayInfo.description: Ola! Welcome to Portugal. When you arrive at the Lisbon airport, you’ll be picked up by a representative and taken to your centrally located hotel. Your adventure officially begins with a welcome meeting at 6 pm tonight. If you arrive early, maybe head to one of the many outdoor cafes and soak up the city’s energy. After your meeting, you’ll join your leader and small group for a welcome dinner at one of Lisbon’s thriving restaurants. Going out to eat is one of Portugal’s great pleasures, and tonight, your leader will introduce you to traditional Portuguese recipes and a culinary scene that’s exploding with regional flavour.

dayInfo.title: Lisbon.
dayInfo.description: This morning, join a local guide for a walking tour through the city of Lisbon. First, take a ride on the historic Gloria cable car – this bright yellow funicular is one of Lisbon’s most photographed images! Then, explore the trendy neighbourhood of Bairro Alto, the popular Chiado area and the narrow, cobbled streets of Alfama, dotted with hole-in-the-wall eateries and old homes. Pop into a local establishment to try a pastel de nata – a sweet and delicious custard tart and Portugal’s most famous pastry. Then visit the elegant Praça do Município, a symbol of the city's post-earthquake reconstruction in the 18th century and the Praça do Comércio, once the gateway to Lisbon for arriving ships and a key hub of maritime trade during the Age of Discoveries.It wouldn’t be a tour of Lisbon without stopping off to sample some ginjinha – Portugal’s iconic cherry liqueur. The rest of your afternoon is free to explore at your own pace.

dayInfo.title: Sintra / Coimbra.
dayInfo.description: Head outside the city for a full-day excursion to Sintra – a resort town in the foothills of the mountains. Your leader will explain how the cooler climate made Sintra a summer retreat for royalty and why it has drawn and inspired many poets, writers and travellers for centuries, including Lord Byron. Spend time exploring Sintra’s intriguing Quinta da Regaleira estate before continuing to the town. You’ll have free time in the afternoon to enjoy the surroundings at your own pace. Perhaps sit down and try some local flavours at lunch, then visit Sintra’s over 1000-year-old National Palace – one of the oldest in Portugal.

dayInfo.title: Coimbra.
dayInfo.description: Sitting on the banks of the River Mondego, Coimbra was once the medieval capital of the county, and its royal heritage can be felt in its ancient streets and buildings. Get to know the city as your leader guides you through the lanes and squares of the Old Quarter this morning. The real star of the show is Coimbra’s prestigious university – one of the oldest in the world. You’ll have a private guided tour of the Joanine Library, a Baroque masterpiece that is widely considered one of the most beautiful libraries in the world. Then this evening, get to know more about this nation’s cultural heritage by heading to a traditional Fado music show. Portugal’s version of the blues is hauntingly beautiful and hearing it performed live is an experience to remember. Your leader can recommend some superb spots to eat after the show.

dayInfo.title: Douro Valley.
dayInfo.description: Travel from Coimbra to the Douro Valley today. Famous for its scenery, the Douro Valley is also known for producing some of the world’s most delicious wine. Today, you’ll head out for a tasting tour at one of the region’s best wineries. You can’t spell Portugal without Port, and to taste this iconic fortified wine is to taste thousands of years of Portuguese history. Learn the story of its origins and the history of wine production in the area while discovering which locally produced vino is your tipple of choice. Sit down to a light picnic lunch of rustic regional specialities prepared with fresh local ingredients (and paired with more wine, of course!). Then continue to your Feature Stay accommodation – tucked away between the rolling hills and terraced vineyards of the spectacular Douro Valley, your home for the night boasts unbeatable views of the Douro River. When you arrive, you might like to make the most of your hotel's scenic outdoor pools, or maybe grab dinner on the terrace and soak in the scenery.

dayInfo.title: Porto.
dayInfo.description: This morning, enjoy a gentle boat ride on the Douro River, stopping by the riverside village of Pinhao. From here, make your way to Porto – a romantic city on the banks of the river. When you arrive, join your leader for an orientation walk through twisting alleys, crisscrossing staircases and baroque churches. Pass old bridges, cobbled streets, merchants’ houses and cafes and explore at your own pace. In the evening, head to the nearby city of Vila Nova de Gaia to end the day with some sunset drinks.

dayInfo.title: Porto.
dayInfo.description: Learn about the history of tiles in Portugal this morning with a tile-painting workshop. Steeped in centuries of tradition, hand-painted tiles can be seen on the facades of buildings and churches, telling the stories of Portugal’s past with vibrant colours and designs. Then, your afternoon is free. Maybe head to one of the city’s riverfront cafes for a coffee and pastry overlooking the colourful rows of old houses or take a walk around the World Heritage listed Ribeira district. Another option is to take the local train to the seaside city of Matosinhos where you can relax on the beach or stroll along the promenade. Regroup tonight for a final dinner at one of Porto’s local restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Porto.
dayInfo.description: There are no activities planned for today and your trip comes to an end. You’re free to leave at any time after check out. If you wish to spend some more time exploring Porto, just get in touch with your booking agent ahead of time to organise additional accommodation.

placesVisited: Porto, Douro Valley, Coimbra, Monastery of Batalha, Alcobaça, Lisbon
generalInfo: Once a powerful kingdom that dominated the world sea routes, Portugal today is one of the most welcoming and peaceful countries in Europe, though the legacy of its former wealth can still be found in its historic cities. Starting from colourful Porto, the second city and a Unesco site, our journey follows the verdant valleys and rolling hills of the Douro wine region, before heading to the lesser-known interior, where we visit Coimbra, the Unesco Batalha monastery, medieval Óbidos before reaching Lisbon, one of the most enchanting capital cities in the world.

dayInfo.description: Our adventure begins in the historic city of Porto. Our hotel is in the Ribeirinha district, close to the historic centre and on the banks of the scenic Douro River. Say olá to you your leader and fellow travellers around 6pm, where we gather as a group for the first time to get to know each other and learn more about the adventure ahead. Your leader will ensure a big welcome by arranging a group dinner at a local restaurant for your first taste of Portuguese hospitality. Want to explore Porto further? Additional pre-tour hotel nights are bookable through your sales representative. Accommodation: Hotel Vila Galé Porto Ribeira (or similar) Upgrade to a river-view or terrace today – speak to your sales representative for more details

Today starts with a guided tour through the historic centre of Porto, a Unesco World Heritage site. As we amble along the ancient streets and medieval lanes, we visit important monuments, including São Bento Station, a neoclassic jewel. In the buzzing, colourful squares and traditional, unique cafes, we discover the authentic heart of the city. There will be some free time for individual sightseeing from about midday. City highlights include Porto Cathedral; Saint Francis Church; Livraria Lello (one of the most beautiful bookstores in the world) and Clérigos Church and Tower. Around 3pm we'll meet near Ribeirinha, the picturesque riverside area, where we enjoy a tour of the historic port wine cellars, ending with a short wine tasting. Afterwards, we transfer by private bus to the Douro Valley (approximately 90 minutes). Accommodation: Hotel Régua Douro (or similar)

Today we explore the heart of the Douro Valley, the first officially designated wine region in the world, renowned for excellent port wine and pretty landscapes of steeply terraced riverside vineyards. In the morning, you have the option to enjoy a leisurely boat cruise along the Douro River. Later, we enjoy a delicious lunch with an included wine tasting in an 18th-century estate surrounded by terraced vineyards that climb high above the dramatic confluence of the Douro and Tedo rivers. In the afternoon, we transfer by private bus to Coimbra (approximately two hours) in the central region of Portugal. Accommodation: Vila Galé Coimbra (or similar) Upgrade to a river-view room today – speak to your sales representative for more details

Known as the City of Students, Coimbra has a history closely linked to the Unesco-listed University of Coimbra, which was founded in 1290 and is the second oldest in Europe. The city is divided into two distinct areas, the baixa (downtown) by the river, where most of the commercial activity is concentrated, and the alta (upper town), home to the oldest and most important buildings, including Sé Velha (Old Cathedral), Sé Nova (New Cathedral) and the university. We visit the most important areas and sites this morning during a guided tour. There will be free time in the afternoon for independent sightseeing before we transfer (approximately one hour) to the peaceful little town of Batalha, the setting of the most important battle in Portugal, the Batalha de Aljubarrota (1385). This battle secured Portuguese independence from Castile, and to honour it, King João I constructed the Mosteiro da Batalha, the finest monastery in Portugal. We visit this Portuguese gothic masterpiece that combines various influences from its lengthy construction, which lasted several reigns. We will have the opportunity to visit the outstanding interior, including the Founders’ Chapel with its fine stained-glass windows, cloisters, the Unfinished Chapels with their Manueline and Flemish gothic features and the Chapter House. Accommodation: Hotel Lis Batalha (or similar) Upgrade to a monastery-view room today – speak to your sales representative for more details

Our first stop today is the seaside town of Nazaré, home to some of the largest surfing waves in the world. There will be time for a stroll, lunch and free time to soak up the lovely atmosphere of this coastal village. Then we move to Óbidos, our base for the night. This small, fortified village resembles a medieval film set. It has been carefully preserved by the inhabitants, who take pride in maintaining the architectural image of the village, characterised by narrow winding streets, whitewashed houses and impressive fort walls, perfect to enjoy after day-trippers have left. We stay overnight in Óbidos. Accommodation: The Literary Man (or similar)

Transfer (one hour) to Lisbon today, one of the most vibrant capital cities in the world. In the morning, we have an orientation walk around the Belém district, in which the guide will highlight the major landmarks, such as the vast Jerónimos Monastery and 16th-century Belém Tower. The remainder of the afternoon is free for relaxation or independent sightseeing in Belém before transferring to our hotel. Accommodation: Hotel Marquês de Pombal (or similar)

Continue to explore the second-oldest capital in Europe (after Athens) on a guided tour today. Lisbon was once home to the explorers Vasco da Gama, Magellan and Prince Henry the Navigator. Today, it is one of the most sought-after destinations, offering delicious food, ancient monuments, quirky cafes, and views over the Tejo river. Lisbon is known as the City of Seven Hills, so wear comfortable shoes and be prepared for a few steep climbs and steps during today’s walking tour. We start with an optional ride on the Lisbon tram, which takes us to the elegant area of Graça. We then descend on foot through Alfama, one of the oldest districts in Lisbon, with its maze of colourful alleyways, old buildings and breath-taking viewpoints. We conclude our busy guided tour in Rossio, the heart of the city. The rest of the day is free for further independent sightseeing. In the evening, you have the option of enjoying a fado experience, to learn more about this traditional musical style, which is thought to have originated in Lisbon itself. Accommodation: Hotel Marquês de Pombal (or similar)

Our trip ends after breakfast. However, with so much to see and do in Lisbon, we recommend adding some extra days after the tour to truly appreciate the many attractions this city offers. Speak to your sales representative to book.

tourName: Perspectives of Portugal: New Takes on Classics
placesVisited: Lisbon, Alentejo, Sintra, Bussaco, Schist Villages, Tomar, Douro Valley, Amarante, Porto
generalInfo: Your experience of storybook palaces and refined wines will immerse you in unique treasures during your 12-day signature Portugal tour specifically designed for 2022. Each day is custom-tailored to your preferences allowing you to bask in a sunset cruise of Lisbon or stroll along Evora’s ancient foundations. From the legacy of the Knights Templar to the vineyard heritage of the Douro Valley, you can embrace a new perspective of Portugal.

dayInfo.title: Lisbon - Welcome to Charming Lisbon
dayInfo.description: Lisbon is a vibrant city that brings the past to life along the historic hills draped in a mixture of bohemian ambiance and historic architecture. Your private transfer will meet you at Lisbon’s Humberto Delgado Airport, where your private transfer will meet you at arrival. After some time with your guide for some tips and hints, the remainder of the day will be at your leisure to enjoy the city. You can stroll along the windy, hilly streets of Bairro Alto where restaurants and cafes may fill the air with the scents of grilling sausages or typical codfish dishes immersing you in Lisbon’s heritage and flavorful history.

dayInfo.title: Lisbon - Explore the Highlights of Lisbon
dayInfo.description: Your private guide will take you into the city as your host of a half-day walking tour of the highlights. You may find yourself basking in the 18th-century elegance of emblematic plazas and cobbled streets in the Baixa district. Stop along the way to taste the famous Pastel de Nata, and then explore Rossio and the beautiful Figueira and Comercio Squares, and then enjoy the glamorous cafes and boutique shops of Chiado. Finish the night with a live performance of Fado with dinner included.

dayInfo.title: Lisbon - Discover Fairytale Sintra
dayInfo.description: Sintra is a glamorous city with a fairytale ambiance. You can wander along the cobbled square leading to the Palacio Nacional de Sintra, where boutique shops and cafes embody the greater city’s colorful atmosphere. You can also visit two other monuments of your choice, such as the Moorish Castle or Monserrate Palace, before visiting Europe’s westernmost point for a view over the Atlantic as you return to Lisbon. The Cabo Da Roca extends its beauty in the ocean, and enjoy a stop at trendy Cascais, the “Portuguese Riviera.”

dayInfo.title: Evora - Embrace Arraiolos and Evora’s Grandeur
dayInfo.description: Travel with your private transfer into Arraiolos, where artistic handwoven carpets parallel the region’s beauty and town’s rich history. You will visit a nearby vineyard to learn more about the heritage of wine in the Alentejo region, crowned with a visit to a working bottling line and cellar visit. You may find the scent of cherry and raspberry offsetting the luscious vanilla notes rising from the glass. Once in Evora, you can bask in the stunning Roman legacy stemming from the 1st-century AD temple and the Moorish cistern hidden beneath the pews of the Sao Joao Evangelista Church as part of this UNESCO heritage site. Spend the evening settling in to your hotel and spa, which will be welcome after your lively day.

dayInfo.title: Evora - Uncover the Traditions of Alentejo
dayInfo.description: Portugal is famous for its cork forest and the production of wine corks. Your guide will take you into the fascinating history and traditions of cork, exploring the eco-friendly raw material beginning in the cork forests. The private estate may fill with a surprising citrus scent stemming from crushed leaves. Your guide will lead you through the forest where the towering trees open to visions of grazing livestock. The estate owner will give you deeper information on the process of extracting cork from the trees. The trees continue to grow after the extraction allowing the forest to rejuvenate.

dayInfo.title: Bussaco - Visit Dramatic Tomar and Reach Bussaco
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet you in the hotel lobby after breakfast and lead you to Tomar, a charming town glowing with a historic center. Swans, herons, and ducks often rest in the riverside park while the crenelated walls of the Convento de Cristo strike a dramatic silhouette against the Seven Hills National Forest’s canopy. The rambling Gothic, Manueline, and Renaissance design of the Knights Templar UNESCO Heritage Site creates an image of extravagance crowning the wooded slopes. You may also stroll along the charming cobbled avenue leading to Tomar’s medieval synagogue to find antique Hebraic inscriptions and rose-colored limestone.

dayInfo.title: Bussaco - Wander the Mountain Schist Villages
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to discover a selection of the Schist Villages at the center of Portugal with hidden forests, authentic culture, and captivating river beaches. You may feel as though you have traveled back in time in places like medieval Talasnal, Casal Novo, or Chiqueiro. Houses and churches shine bright white against the surrounding greenery on a plateau that gives you an enchanting view in every direction. Spend the afternoon enjoying the grounds and surroundings of your beautiful hotel.

dayInfo.title: Douro Valley - Indulge in Wine at Douro Valley
dayInfo.description: You will travel to Pinháo in the morning with your private driver to reach the heart of the Douro Valley and the town encircled by terraced hills brimming with vineyards. The train station glows with hand-painted azulejos tiles depicting the grape harvest setting the tone for your tour through the vineyards. You can bask in the views of the landscape with a scenic boat tour on a typical wooden boat meant to carry Port wine to Porto. After, you will visit a selection of popular and boutique wineries with a gourmet picnic lunch along the river. Finish the afternoon with your arrival at your wine estate, your accommodations for the night.

dayInfo.title: Porto - Travel the Famous Vinho Verde to Porto
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will take you along the great Vinho Verde region to Porto, unveiling the majestic winding landscape along the Tamega River. In the town of Amarante, you can enjoy the sleepy ambiance contrasting the dramatic monastery and the image of the medieval bridge, as well as willows lining the riverbanks. Stop in Amarante for some of the famous sweets, from the Papos de Angel to the Breezes of the Tamega. In Penafiel, you can enjoy ancient wine traditions of the region’s micro-climates as you arrive at your next estate. Explore the cellar and the vineyards, and then have a guided visit with a tasting. Have lunch on the terrace with a view of the vineyards, and then continue on to Porto.

dayInfo.title: Porto - Experience Porto��’s Charming Culture
dayInfo.description: Travel away from Porto’s typical experiences for a unique fishing excursion that plunges you into Portugal’s legacy of the sea. The traditional boats will return from the sea, bringing streaks of color back to the marina as fishermen and local sellers begin bargaining for the freshest fish in the market. You can also choose your own fresh catch that will be prepared for you at a local restaurant to create the perfect Portuguese dish. Back in Porto, you will have a guided tasting of a port wine cellar on the riverbanks, a significant part of the legacy of this region.

dayInfo.title: Lisbon - Journey to Lisbon for Sunset
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your private driver will lead you to Obidos. The charming town embodies the nobility and artistic charm with whitewashed cottages, alluring cafes, and handcraft stores lining narrow cobbled lanes. The medieval walls create an elaborate border around the town defending the central Santa Maria Church, which glows blue and white from the azulejos tiles. After settling into Lisbon, you will embark on a private sailing excursion for breathtaking views of the old city climbing out of the riverbanks. The colors of the sunset may glint against the whitewashed buildings of the Alfama, showcasing a distinctive glow across the sky as you enjoy a magnificent dinner on board.

dayInfo.title: Lisbon - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you may choose to wander the historic streets or relax into a leisurely breakfast. After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you in the hotel lobby when you are ready and escort you to Lisbon’s international airport for your flight home with plenty of time to check-in for your flight.

tourName: Sweeping 5-Star Exploration of Portugal: City, Country, and Island Tour
placesVisited: Amarante, Lamego, Douro Valley, Évora, Ponta Delgada, Coimbra (City), Porto (City), Braga, Lisbon, São Miguel das Missões
generalInfo: Experience the best of Portugal in regal fashion as you tour highlight destinations, wallow in luxury adventures, and embrace the majesty of the country’s culture as you spend 17 days exploring the regality on offer. From charming hideaway towns overflowing with historic elegance to staggering seascapes viewed from sweeping geothermal landscapes, the beauty and culture of Portugal await your discovery.

dayInfo.title: Coimbra - A Piece of History in Óbidos
dayInfo.description: Arriving in the city of Lisbon, you will take your first steps on Portuguese soil before being collected by your private transfer and taken through to Coimbra for the evening. Along the way, you will make a stop at the charming town of Óbidos. White-washed buildings will compose the town’s low-hanging skyline and bougainvilleas will decorate the window sills of quaint homes peppering its modest districts. Within its medieval walls, culture is preserved and you will come to appreciate your quiet arrival as you peruse the light-flooded town squares and heritage sites including the century-old Batalha Monastery.

dayInfo.title: Coimbra - Ancient Knowledge of Portugal
dayInfo.description: In Coimbra, history is celebrated in the conserved heritage sites speckling its buzzing districts and you will traceback Portuguese stories as you meander these humming parts. The Coimbra University stands as the oldest tertiary educational institution in the country, and it will welcome you to explore its ancient knowledge housed within its historic walls. Afterward, you will wander the aisles of Joanine Library, a hallowed literary site boasting a collection of more than 300,000 evocative works cataloged and organized in gilt-covered bookcases.

dayInfo.title: Porto - Stylistic Features of Ílhavo and Aveiro
dayInfo.description: You will spend your third evening in Portugal in the city of Porto, finding refuge in the endearing towns of Ílhavo and Aveiro before you arrive. In the historic fishermen village of Ílhavo, 19-century charm and colorful layers of paint decorate the buildings lining the seaboard, an image worth capturing before you make way for Aveiro. In Aveiro, scenes of small boats gliding along a network of channels weaving through the city are reminiscent of Venice. Art Nouveau buildings will backdrop the scenes of the sparkling channels as you slowly wander through elegant town squares.

dayInfo.title: Porto - Cultural Gems of the City
dayInfo.description: With a day to explore Porto, you will be spoiled for choice as you map out your city tour with your knowledgeable private tour guide. From the remarkable azulejo art, a distinct Portuguese ceramic tile artwork, that veils the wall of the São Bento Station to the historic baroque architecture composing the Clérigos Tower as well as the impressively displayed collection of the Lello bookshop, Porto is a wondrous city filled with cultural experiences set to sweep you off your feet.

dayInfo.title: Porto - Roman Origins and the Birth of Portugal
dayInfo.description: Today, you will visit the historic cities that surround Porto’s buzzing cityscape. Chaperoned by an insightful tour guide, you will make your way to Braga, the regional juridical capital of the Roman Empire in the Iberian Peninsula. The city’s cathedral is a sight to behold, steeped in folklore you will uncover as you wander through its timeless halls. Afterward, you will continue to a city that is famed as being the birthplace of Portugal, Guimarães. Perusing heritage sites that lay out the origins of Portugal’s identity, you will understand the country on a much deeper level after today.

dayInfo.title: Lamego - Astonishing Scenes in Amarante
dayInfo.description: On the sixth day of your vacation, you will retreat to the spectacular Douro Valley, stopping at the traditional town of Amarante along the way. Amarante will share fables of Portugal’s warring eras as you tour its significant bridge that stood as the last line of defense during the Second French Invasion. Furthermore, the natural beauty that surrounds Amarante is rarely rivaled, as you will come to discern gazing up at the crest of the rising Serra do Marão and across the staggering blue stretch of the Tâmega tributary.

dayInfo.title: Lamego - Dazzling Vintages of the Douro Valley
dayInfo.description: Schist mountains, dramatic expanses of flourishing forest, and a vast winding blue ribbon of river are but a few of the paradisiacal features of the breathtaking Douro Valley, the region you will call home during your stay in Lamego. Today, you will tour the surrounding illustrious landscape, finding a comfortable place to rest at the elite wine estates where you may indulge in an assortment of prestigious vintages while nature bursts to life around you. Dreamy scenes of the cascading emerald vineyards and the blossoming flowers will backdrop your afternoon wine tasting experience.

dayInfo.title: Évora - The City of the Knights Templar
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will continue your travels through Portugal south towards Évora, stopping at the Knights Templar City Tomar en route. Intended as the home and headquarters of the fabled organization, Tomar is an elaborately designed cityscape boasting impressive architectural constructs showcasing the gothic, renaissance, and baroque works of the visionaries who built it. You will link the city’s design with the heritage on which it stands as you peruse several significant Templar heritage sites at your own leisure before reaching Évora.

dayInfo.title: Évora - Moorish Ancestry and the Spirit of Évora
dayInfo.description: Within the medieval walls of Évora, you will find solace in the charming and humble historic beats that form its romantic skyline. Escorted by an intelligent tour guide, you will be shown to many iconic landmarks and hallowed locations sharing insight into Portuguese art and architecture. The Moorish roots of Évora’s ancestry can be found within the structures that form the Graça Church and São Francisco Church, as well as the details and emblematic curations housed within the Chapel of Bones.

dayInfo.title: Lisbon - Animal Sightings in the Arrábida Natural Park
dayInfo.description: You will head to the Portuguese capital, Lisbon, today but not before you visit the majestic Arrábida Natural Park. This remarkable slice of natural paradise consists of chalk-white cliffs starkly contrasting with the azure blue sea that circles them, as well as forests of thick emerald vegetation that veil the landscape beyond the seaboard. With viewpoints boasting panoramas of the seascape and resting stops poised beneath the proliferating canopy, you will be entranced by the flora and fauna sightings enjoyed in the Arrábida Natural Park.

dayInfo.title: Lisbon - Cultural and Culinary Customs
dayInfo.description: You will immerse yourself in Portuguese culture and tradition today as you join an exceptional tour guide for an insider look at the city’s highlights culminating with an exquisite cooking class led by a professional chef. During your tour of the cosmopolitan city, you will visit several charming districts drenched in heritage sites for you to unravel Portuguese history before your afternoon culinary experience. Your cooking class will share the secrets behind some of Portugal’s delicacies, helping you prepare them yourself for you to sink your teeth into come the end of the class.

dayInfo.title: Lisbon - Romance on the Sintra Mountain
dayInfo.description: On the final day of your stay in Lisbon, you will join an experienced guide and head for the hills of Sintra, soaring to the summit to delve into the Romantic Era history that shrouds the Pena Palace. Appreciate the views and get lost in the majesty of the meticulous building before you return to Lisbon for a traditional dinner unlike any other. On the stylish terrace of a Fado House, you will feast on an assortment of Portuguese delicacies while the gentle melodies of Fado music set an atmospheric mood.

dayInfo.title: Ponta Delgada - Set Course for São Miguel
dayInfo.description: You will soar from mainland Portugal to the island of São Miguel today for a few nights spent in the spectacular seaside city of Ponta Delgada. Capital of the Azores archipelago and gateway to the crater lakes of the Sete Cidades, Ponta Delgada is an idyllic destination both rich in culture and an entry point to the natural wonders of São Miguel. After your journey in, you will have the afternoon to relax and unwind, relishing the amenities shared at your exquisite accommodation including a therapeutic spa treatment to revitalize the mind and body.

dayInfo.title: Ponta Delgada - Picture-Perfect Moments on the Sete Cidades
dayInfo.description: São Miguel is famous for its iconic lakes and today, you will join a knowledgeable tour guide in a 4x4 Jeep to see these phenomenal sights for yourself. Your voyage of the Sete Cidades will begin atop the King’s View lookout point where the Verde and Azul lagoons can be seen unrolling across the giant crater. Afterward, you will arrive at the Lagoa do Fogo and climb the rolling hills of Água do Pau to find refuge alongside the tranquil balmy waters of the Caldeira Velha, surrounded by the thick forests and soundtracked by the singing wildlife.

dayInfo.title: Ponta Delgada - Cauldrons Cooking in the Caldera
dayInfo.description: Your second 4x4 Jeep tour of Ponta Delgada on the fifteenth day of your vacation will lead you to Vale das Furnas, a geothermal destination composed of twenty thermal springs. The bubbling water beneath the earth will rise from these springs and steam will pour out over the landscape, creating a natural mist that veils the region. In this boiling earth, a traditional Cozido nas Caldeiras , a Portuguese mixed stew cooked in cauldrons dipped into the piping hot earth, will be prepared for you and enjoyed alongside panoramas of the bewitching landscape.

dayInfo.title: Ponta Delgada - Cetacean Sightings Off the Azores
dayInfo.description: The Azores archipelago is one of the largest whale sanctuaries in the world, offering visitors opportunities to witness these majestic creatures among other mesmerizing marine life during their stay. Today, you will join your captain and set sail across the sea in search of whale sightings on an unforgettable whale watching tour. You will watch as their monstrous bodies rise to the surface and sink back below to its navy depths, while also spotting numerous other cetaceans wallowing in the temperate waters in search of a snack to tuck into.

dayInfo.title: Ponta Delgada - Tchau to Portugal
dayInfo.description: Though coming to an end, your trip will not yet be over as you may enjoy your final morning lapping up the luxury of your accommodation and Ponta Delgada’s elegant districts. After enjoying a sumptuous breakfast, you may stroll the bustling streets down back alleys where you will find hidden boutique stores and stylish cafés where you may purchase tokens of your trip and savor sweet pastries before you leave. You will be collected shortly thereafter and taken to the airport where you will say tchau to Portugal
